verses.name: Romans 14:1
verses.text: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye, but not to doubtful disputations.

verses.name: Romans 14:2
verses.text: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.

verses.name: Romans 14:3
verses.text: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.

verses.name: Romans 14:4
verses.text: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.

verses.name: Romans 14:5
verses.text: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day alike. Let every man be fully persuaded in his own mind.

verses.name: Romans 14:6
verses.text: He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the Lord; and he that regardeth not the day, to the Lord he doth not regard it. He that eateth, eateth to the Lord, for he giveth God thanks; and he that eateth not, to the Lord he eateth not, and giveth God thanks.

verses.name: Romans 14:7
verses.text: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.

verses.name: Romans 14:8
verses.text: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.

verses.name: Romans 14:9
verses.text: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.

verses.name: Romans 14:10
verses.text: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.

verses.name: Romans 14:11
verses.text: For it is written, As I live, saith the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

verses.name: Romans 14:12
verses.text: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

verses.name: Romans 14:13
verses.text: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother’s way.

verses.name: Romans 14:14
verses.text: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that there is nothing unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth any thing to be unclean, to him it is unclean.

verses.name: Romans 14:15
verses.text: But if thy brother be grieved with thy meat, now walkest thou not charitably. Destroy not him with thy meat, for whom Christ died.

verses.name: Romans 14:16
verses.text: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

verses.name: Romans 14:17
verses.text: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Romans 14:18
verses.text: For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God, and approved of men.

verses.name: Romans 14:19
verses.text: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

verses.name: Romans 14:20
verses.text: For meat destroy not the work of God. All things indeed are pure; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.

verses.name: Romans 14:21
verses.text: It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any thing whereby thy brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

verses.name: Romans 14:22
verses.text: Hast thou faith? have it to thyself before God. Happy is he that condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

verses.name: Romans 14:23
verses.text: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because he eateth not of faith: for whatsoever is not of faith is sin.
